results.title: A Different approach
results.creator_credit: Belfern Productions, Fern Field and Jim Belcher
results.brief_description: A young filmmaker, hired to make a sombre straight-forward film about the reasons employers should hire the disabled, decides instead to take an innovative, irreverent approach to what is usually a piously hush-hush subject. The film shows him screening his film to an incredulous audience and trying to convince them that his different approach is the right one. Stars Michael Keaton with cameo appearances by Martin Mull, Ed Asner, Jim Nabors and Carroll O’Connor.

results.title: A Desperate fortune: Matthew Flinders' Australia
results.creator_credit: A to Z Communications, Jack Smith and Antony J. Bowman
results.brief_description: A documentary style drama depicting the life and times of one of Australia’s greatest explorers. Matthew Flinders was the first man to circumnavigate the vast island continent known in the 18th century as New Holland. However few people are aware that he was also the first person to formally name it Australia. This is not simply a story of an extraordinary man’s courage and perseverance throughout a series of arduous voyages, but a romantic adventure fraught with all the inevitable dangers and excitement of conquering an untamed land. Narrated by Edward Woodward.

results.title: A Desperate case
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: A cautionary tale of a typical holiday suitcase. Crammed beyond its capacity, imperfectly fastened, inadequately and confusedly labelled, the railways transport it from station to station, seeking its true abode. Finally, one of its owners comes to the nightmare tribunal where those who maltreat their luggage are dealt with. Did it happen? Was it a dream? Be warned. See this film. Avoid making yours a desperate case.

results.title: A Depression
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Robert Anderson and Henwar Rodakiewicz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
The case of a young man shown during and after recovery from a severe depression. The patient attempted to kill his wife, son and himself. He is interviewed by a psychiatrist and the prognosis and treatment are discussed. After a course of drugs and psychiatric treatment there is a remarkable improvement.

group_works.title: Just one of those things (TEFC)

results.title: A Demonstration of basic film techniques
results.brief_description: Designed to serve as a practical aid for teachers presenting a course in film appreciation. Experience has shown that one of the first barriers to be broken down in such a course is the students’ ignorance of the fact that a film is MADE, that it is the result of conscious decision by the film maker. Teachers may use it to demonstrate the more common shots in film making. They may use it to establish the idea of film editing - the joining together of separate shots into a meaningful unit. The film’s deficiencies and faults should serve as valuable teaching points during discussion after the film.

results.title: A Democratic time-bomb
results.creator_credit: Dimbleby Partners, Totem Productions, BBC and Francis Gerard
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Last governor”.
Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby, episode one begins in 1992 as Conservative MP Chris Patten leaves for Hong Kong. He was the first politician and non diplomat to be elected governor, and he was the last governor of Hong Kong before the country was handed back to China. This episode looks at the business and democratic culture of Hong Kong, the influence of colonisation on culture, the role of the media in Patten’s term, an historical overview of Asia-British relations, and the migration of Chinese peoples to Hong Kong and their present status in Hong Kong society. The episode concludes with Patten having met with Chinese delegates to discuss the terms and conditions of democratic reform.

results.title: A Decade under the influence
results.creator_credit: Independent Film Channel, Gini Reticker, Jerry Kupfer, Richard LaGravenese and Ted Demme
results.brief_description: The 1970s was a revolutionary time for cinema; coming off the domineering era of the studio system, a new breed of filmmakers emerged with their own agendas, styles and stories to tell. Men such as Coppola, Scorsese, Hopper, Bogdanovich, Friedkin, Pollack, Cassevetes and Altman, transformed the industry with their raw and un-compromising stories that revelled not in escapism, but in realism, tackling such issues as the Vietnam War, the sexual revolution and their generation’s disenchantment with the false ideals and corruptness of society. Using clips from an array of films, and a slew of interviews with key players from the time, this documentary presents a thorough (but by no means exhaustive) and entertaining overview of the period, ending with the introduction of the first blockbusters of the 1970s “Jaws” and “Star Wars”. Interviewees include Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola, William Friedkin, Sydney Pollack, Ellen Burstyn, Julie Christie, Robert Altman, Dennis Hopper, Paul Schrader, Pam Grier, Jon Voight and Bruce Dern.

results.title: A Death in the family
results.creator_credit: James H. Wallace, New Zealand Film Commission, Television New Zealand, Stewart Main and Peter Wells
results.brief_description: An outstanding dramatisation of a group of gay men nursing a friend dying of AIDS in his final 16 days. This beautifully shot film addresses the private realities of living and loving against the public front of a “horror” disease.
